author: Staff Reporter
text:
Fishermen flash ‘Vote May 16’ message from the boats

Afloat on a mission:A group of fisherman flashing voter awareness message from country boats at sea in Threspuram on Saturday.— Photo: N. Rajesh

As part of the exercise to create voter awareness, the fishermen here came out with a novel way to appeal to the voters to cast their votes in the May 16 Assembly election.

Volunteers from the fishermen community organised a programme onboard the fishing boats off Threspuram coast on Saturday.

Carrying placards reading ‘Vote May 16’, the volunteers onboard four country boats stressed the importance of voting.

A series of awareness programmes, involving students, on the significance of voting were being organised through Systematic Voters’ Education and Electoral Participation (SVEEP), Thoothukudi Sub-Collector and Returning Officer S. Gopala Sundara Raj said.

Stickers on family cards

The volunteers had also started pasting stickers stressing the importance of voting on family cards. Mr. Gopala Sundara Raj said that around 79,000 cardholders were residing in the constituency.

Low turnout

During the previous Assembly election in 2011, 73.66 per cent polling was recorded in Thoothukudi constituency, and the polling percentage in the last Lok Sabha elections in 2014 in the same constituency dropped to 67.89.

Hence, more awareness of polling was being spread through various programmes, he said.
title: Voter awareness campaign goes onboard country boats
